dataset.title: NSF Business Research and Development and Innovation Survey
dataset.description: The Business Research and Development and Innovation Survey, successor to the Survey of Industrial Research and Development, is the primary source of information on research and development performed or funded by businesses within the United States from 2008-2010. The survey is conducted by the Census Bureau in accordance with an interagency agreement with the National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics. Results are used to assess trends in the performance and funding of business R&D. The annual survey examines a nationally representative sample of companies in manufacturing and nonmanufacturing industries.
keyword: brdis nsf surveyresearch development r d science engineering census

dataset.title: NSF Conference Report for FY12
dataset.description: OMB Memorandum M-12-12 requires federal agencies to report by January 31st of each year, information on all agency-sponsored conferences from the previous year where the net expenses for each single conference were in excess of $100,000. dataset.title: NSF Images and Video RSS feed
dataset.description: An RSS feed containing links to multimedia files, including images and video, related to the National Science Foundation and its mission.

dataset.title: NSF Industrial Research and Development Information System (IRIS)
dataset.description: This database holds all of the statistics produced by the National Science Foundation's Survey of Industry Research and Development (SIRD) for 1953 to 2007, the last year SIRD was conducted. It has been replaced by the Business Research and Development and Innovation Survey (BRDIS), which expands NSF's coverage of business R&D and innovation activities. IRIS data prior to 1999 are based on Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) and pre-SIC codes. Beginning with the 1999 survey, estimates are based on the North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS).
keyword: brdis iris nsf survey research development r d science engineering industrial

dataset.title: NSF Information Widget
dataset.description: The NSF Information Widget provides Mac users with easy access to the latest NSF releases for News, Discoveries, Funding Opportunities and Publications.
keyword: nsf news discoveries funding publications mac widget

dataset.title: NSF Key Science and Engineering Indicators: Digest 2010
dataset.description: This 2010 digest of key S&E indicators draws from the National Science Board's Science and Engineering Indicators report. The digest serves to draw attention to important trends and data points from across Indicators and to introduce readers to the data resources available in the report.
keyword: federal government education labor employment workforce research development industry international

dataset.title: NSF Key Science and Engineering Indicators: Digest 2012
dataset.description: This 2012 digest of key S&E indicators is an interactive tool that draws from the National Science Board's (NSB's) Science and Engineering Indicators report. The digest serves to draw attention to important trends and data points from across Indicators and to introduce readers to the data resources available in the report.
keyword: federal government education labor employment workforce research development industry international

dataset.title: NSF Open Government Directive Plan
dataset.description: The plan serves as the roadmap for NSF's plans to improve transparency, better integrate public participation and collaboration into the core mission, and become more innovative and efficient.

dataset.title: NSF Performance Data for Major IT Investments
dataset.description: The purpose of the Dashboard is to provide information on the effectiveness of government IT programs and to support decisions regarding the investment and management of resources. The Dashboard is now being used by the Administration and Congress to make budget and policy decisions.

dataset.title: NSF Publications RSS feed

dataset.title: NSF Report on Women, Minorities, and Persons with Disabilities in Science and Engineering
dataset.description: Women, Minorities, and Persons with Disabilities in Science and Engineering provides statistical information about the participation of women, minorities, and persons with disabilities in science and engineering education and employment.

dataset.title: NSF Reports to Congress
dataset.description: This web page provides links to agency reports to Congress required by statute.

dataset.title: NSF Research Grant Funding Rate History
dataset.description: An text/xml file containing FY 2001 - FY 2013 National Science Foundation (NSF) funding rates for competitive research proposals by organizational unit. The funding rate is calculated by dividing the number of awards by the number of awards and declines.

dataset.title: NSF Research Grant Funding Rates: Current Year
dataset.description: An text/xml file containing FY 2013 NSF funding rates for competitive research proposals by organizational unit. The funding rate is calculated by dividing the number of awards by the number of awards and declines.

dataset.title: NSF Research Spending and Results
dataset.description: Research Spending & Results gives the public, the scientific community, and Congress insight into federally funded research. Research Spending & Results provides information about how federal research dollars are being spent, what research is being performed, and how the outcomes of research are benefiting society as a whole. Anyone can easily access, search, and sort information in new ways through Research.gov. Currently, information is available for NSF and NASA awards.
keyword: national aeronautics and space administration national aeronautics and space administration stem

dataset.title: NSF Review of Web Measurement and Customization Technologies
dataset.description: NSF is required to review its use of web measurement and customization technologies annually to ensure compliance with all laws, regulations, and OMB guidance.

dataset.title: NSF Science and Engineering Indicators: 2012
dataset.description: Science and Engineering Indicators (SEI) comprises quantitative data on the U.S. and international science and engineering enterprise. The "indicators" are quantitative representations that provide summary information on the scope, quality, and vitality of science and engineering. SEI employs a variety of presentation styles including tables, figures, narrative text, bulleted text, Web-based links, highlights, introductions, conclusions, reference list to make the data accessible to readers with different information needs and information-processing preferences. SEI's 8 chapters cover the following subjects: 1) Elementary and Secondary Mathematics and Science Education 2) Higher Education in Science and Engineering 3) Science and Engineering Labor Force 4) Research and Development: National Trends and International Comparisons 5) Academic Research and Development 6) Industry, Technology, and the Global Marketplace 7) Science and Technology: Public Attitudes and Understanding 8) State Indicators SEI is prepared by the National Science Foundation's National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics (NCSES) under the guidance of the National Science Board (Board). It is subject to extensive review by outside experts, interested federal agencies, Board members, and NSF internal reviewers for accuracy, coverage, and balance.
keyword: federal government education labor employment workforce research development industry international

dataset.title: NSF Science and Engineering Indicators: 2014
dataset.description: Science and Engineering Indicators (SEI) comprises quantitative data on the U.S. and international science and engineering enterprise. The "indicators" are quantitative representations that provide summary information on the scope, quality, and vitality of science and engineering. SEI employs a variety of presentation styles including tables, figures, narrative text, bulleted text, Web-based links, highlights, introductions, conclusions, reference list to make the data accessible to readers with different information needs and information-processing preferences. SEI's 8 chapters cover the following subjects: 1) Elementary and Secondary Mathematics and Science Education 2) Higher Education in Science and Engineering 3) Science and Engineering Labor Force 4) Research and Development: National Trends and International Comparisons 5) Academic Research and Development 6) Industry, Technology, and the Global Marketplace 7) Science and Technology: Public Attitudes and Understanding 8) State Indicators. SEI is prepared by the National Science Foundation's National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics (NCSES) under the guidance of the National Science Board (Board). It is subject to extensive review by outside experts, interested federal agencies, Board members, and NSF internal reviewers for accuracy, coverage, and balance.
keyword: federal government education labor employment workforce research development industry international

dataset.title: NSF Science and Engineering Indicators: 2014 State Data Tool
dataset.description: The State Data Tool draws from the National Science Board's (NSB's) Science and Engineering Indicators report. This tool allows for interactive visual exploration of 58 state indicators covering the role of science and technology (S&T) in state and regional economic development. It covers state trends in S&T education, the employed workforce, finance, and research and development. The tool allows for in-depth exploration of a single indicator, comparisons of multiple indicators, and the ability to customize the graphics. Exploring a single indicator can be done using Tables, Chart or Map view. Comparisons of indicators can be done across states or across years. The tool contains up to 20 years of data when data are available and comparable.
keyword: federal government education labor employment workforce research development industry international

dataset.title: NSF Science and Engineering State Profiles
dataset.description: The National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics (NCSES) of the National Science Foundation (NSF) periodically releases updates to its Science and Engineering State Profiles. Science and Engineering State Profiles allows users to generate science and engineering (S&E) profiles that summarize state-specific data on personnel and finances. The State Profiles data tool can display a single state's profile or a profile containing up to 10 states.
keyword: science engineering indicators statistics nsf national science foundation nsb national science

dataset.title: NSF Speeches by the Director and Deputy Director
dataset.description:
Recent speeches by the NSF Director and Deputy Director - http://www.nsf.gov/news/speeches/
 Speech Archives (older speeches, as well as speeches by former Directors and Deputy Directors) - http://www.nsf.gov/news/speeches/speech_archives.jsp

dataset.title: NSF Spending Data
dataset.description: Agency spending information from USAspending.gov

dataset.title: NSF Spending Under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009
dataset.description: Recovery.gov is the U.S. government's official website that provides easy access to data related to Recovery Act spending and allows for the reporting of potential fraud, waste, and abuse.

dataset.title: NSF Staff Directory
dataset.description: Locate staff by searching or browsing staff and offices

dataset.title: NSF State Obligations by Fiscal Year
dataset.description: An text/xml file containing FY 2001 through FY 2013 National Science Foundation (NSF) obligations by state and account.

dataset.title: NSF Statistics on U.S. Science and Engineering Resources RSS feed
dataset.description: An RSS feed that includes recent publications and information releases from NSF's National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics (NCSES).
keyword: nsf ncses statistics publications Science engineering rss

dataset.title: NSF Strategic Plan for Fiscal Years (FY) 2014-2018
dataset.description: The NSF Strategic Plan for Fiscal Years (FY) 2014-2018 sets the Foundation's direction for the next five years.

dataset.title: NSF Survey of Doctoral Recipients
dataset.description: The Survey of Doctorate Recipients is a longitudinal biennial survey conducted since 1973 that provides demographic and career history information about individuals with a research doctoral degree in a science, engineering, or health (SEH) field from a U.S. academic institution. The survey follows a sample of individuals with SEH doctorates throughout their careers from the year of their degree award until age 76.

dataset.title: NSF Testimony Before Congressional Hearings
dataset.description: NSF Staff Testimony - Current Congress and Previous Congresses, and NSB Testimony.

dataset.title: NSF Upcoming Due Dates RSS feed
dataset.description: An RSS feed containing upcoming due dates for NSF funding opportunties.

dataset.title: NSF Vacancies (Administrative) RSS feed
dataset.description: An RSS feed that includes all open vacancies for Administrative positions at the National Science Foundation.
keyword: nsf career vacancies job openings rss administrative

dataset.title: NSF Vacancies (All Positions) RSS feed
dataset.description: An RSS feed that includes all open vacancies at the National Science Foundation.
keyword: nsf career vacancies job openings rss

dataset.title: NSF Vacancies (Clerical and Technical) RSS feed
dataset.description: An RSS feed that includes all open vacancies for Clerical and Technical positions at the National Science Foundation.

dataset.description: An RSS feed that includes all open vacancies for Executive positions at the National Science Foundation.

dataset.title: NSF Vacancies (Scientific and Professional) RSS feed
dataset.description: An RSS feed that includes all open vacancies for Scientific and Professional positions at the National Science Foundation.

dataset.title: NSF Vacancies (Special Emphasis Programs) RSS feed
dataset.description: An RSS feed that includes all open vacancies for Special Emphasis Programs at the National Science Foundation.

dataset.title: NSF YouTube
dataset.description: NSF's YouTube site provides science-themed videos are available for viewing and comment.

dataset.title: SESTAT
dataset.description: National Survey of College Graduates (NSCG), National Survey of Recent College Graduates (NSRCG), Survey of Doctorate Recipients (SDR)
keyword: doctoral degree doctorate employment in science and engineering s e

dataset.title: WebCASPAR
dataset.description: The WebCASPAR database provides easy access to a large body of statistical data resources for science and engineering (S&E) at U.S. academic institutions. WebCASPAR emphasizes S&E, but its data resources also provide information on non-S&E fields and higher education in general.
